conversation.message:
Thank you, Parent_D, for reaching out with such insightful questions. We are happy to elaborate on our educational methodology, as fostering creative problem-solving and ensuring a successful transition to primary school are cornerstones of our program.

Creative problem-solving is integrated daily through our project-based learning model. We emphasize open-ended inquiry and critical thinking, providing children with rich materials and scenarios that require collaborative solutions and divergent thinking, rather than just seeking a single correct answer. Our educators act as facilitators, guiding children to analyze challenges and test hypotheses in a supportive environment.

Regarding primary school transition, we have a robust Readiness Program. This involves systematically developing foundational literacy (phonemic awareness, systematic phonics) and numeracy (conceptual understanding of quantity, patterns, and spatial reasoning) skills. We conduct individualized assessments to ensure every child meets developmental milestones necessary for a confident start in Grade 1. We believe this blend of creative exploration and structured readiness provides the best preparation. We welcome any further questions you may have about specifics!
